BEPO will be there for you. No questions asked.
SO GREAT. Sororities: Phi Mu Kappa Alpha Theta Alpha Gamma Delta Alpha Sigma Tau Fraternities: Alpha Tau Omega Phi Kappa Tau Phi Delta Theta
There is a club for anything you could want to get involved in
Musicians, music lovers, nursing students

The Battle of the Boulevard is our biannual basketball game against our across the street rival, Lipscomb University. It is all in good fun! Greek Week and Greek sing! It is when the sororities and fraternities compete against one another in challenges throughout the week. SO FUN!

Go downtown and go line dancing, to karaoke, listen to live music, or just people watch. Join greek life and get involved in one of the great sororities or fraternities. And of course, cheer on the bruins!

The caf right now doesn't always have the highest quality food. However, Belmont is currently building a new Dining Hall which is said to be completed in 2015. There are plenty of other good on campus and close to on campus eating options as well.

The freshman dorms are amazing. The older ones have a great sense of community and the newer dorms are top of the line. You can either have suite style or community style bathrooms, people tend to like both! Big rooms too!

Depending on your year or course of study, some classes will be harder than others, which is to be expected. What makes up for the harder classes are the great teachers and small class sizes. You get a lot of one on one time with the teacher and they truly want you to succeed.
Visit the school and stay with a student or experience a class. We love to have visitors and show people around our school

Belmont is great for musicians and music lovers alike! There is so much to get involved with on campus and Nashville is so diverse with a multitude of things to do. The campus is stunning and the class sizes are perfect for a focused college environment.

During basketball season, there are so many chances to go show your school spirit and support for the student athletes! There are also a plethora of interesting convocation events scheduled throughout the year- from personal development events dealing with sex and religion to culture and arts events with African drum demonstrations to community service events that allow student to get involved with the community surrounding Belmont! I love Belmont! I have made some great connections within the few months that I have been here! With the large amount of music and music business majors, there are some many opportunities to start a professional career! I have already sang back-up for an artist here on campus for one of their performances. I have recently started working with this producer, and I have a recording session coming up! I am also involved with organizations that are helping me develop a wide array of skills! I do 60 hours of volunteer service every semester, and it is awesome!
